Worker Amit can complete a job in 10 days. Worker Vikram can complete the same job in 12 days. If both work together for 2 days, then Amit leaves, how many more days will Vikram take to finish the remaining work?
solution: Combined rate = 1/10 + 1/12 = 0.1833. Work done in 2 days = 0.3667. Remaining = 0.6333. Time for Vikram = 0.6333/(1/12) = 7.6 days

story: Worker Priya can complete a job in 8 days. Worker Karan can complete the same job in 10 days. If both work together for 3 days, then Karan leaves, how many more days will Priya take to finish the remaining work?
solution: Combined rate = 1/8 + 1/10 = 0.225. Work done = 0.675. Remaining = 0.325. Time = 0.325/(1/8) = 2.6 days

story: Pipe A fills a tank in 8 hours. Pipe B fills the tank in 10 hours. If both pipes are opened together, but Pipe B is closed after 3 hours, how much total time will it take to fill the tank?
solution: Combined rate = 1/8 + 1/10 = 0.225. Work done in 3 hours = 0.675. Time for A alone = 0.325/(1/8) = 2.6. Total = 5.6 hours

story: Pipe A fills a tank in 12 hours. Pipe B fills the tank in 15 hours. If both pipes are opened together, but Pipe B is closed after 4 hours, how much total time will it take to fill the tank?
solution: Combined rate = 1/12 + 1/15 = 0.15. Work in 4 hours = 0.6. Remaining = 0.4. Time for A = 4.8. Total = 8.8 hours

The ratio of ages of a father and son is 5:2. 10 years ago, the ratio was 5:2. What is the father's present age?
solution: Let Father = 5x, Son = 2x. From past: (5x-10)/(2x-10) = 5/2. Solving: x = 10. Father = 50 years

story: A boat travels 20 km downstream in 2 hours and the same distance upstream in 4 hours. What is the speed of the boat in still water?
solution: Downstream = 20/2 = 10 km/h. Upstream = 20/4 = 5 km/h. Boat speed = (10+5)/2 = 7.5 km/h
